website_summaries.verdict: Between its Bold Brew, iced beverage, and fast-brewing features, Keurig’s K-Elite is more advanced than you may expect a single serve coffee maker to be.
pros: Brews a cup in under a minute
cons: Fairly pricy for a single-serve Keurig

customer_reviews.title: Keurig K-Elite Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for the first 6 months. Now it has a problem. It randomly only fills the coffee cup about 2/3rds full. Have not figured out why yet. I always keep the water reservoir full, so that is not the problem. I will contact Keurig to see if the can fix or replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Barry of Orange

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: Only had this a few weeks but, I’m very happy with this new Keurig. Hopefully it lasts longer than my Keurig 2.0! I love that it has a 12 oz cup option.
customer_reviews.author: summerulz

customer_reviews.title: Works great. This model has the smallest cup size available ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. This model has the smallest cup size available of all the Keurig makers, and therefore the strongest, most concentrated cup of coffee. You can always make a weaker cup by making the cup larger = using more water. Love having a perfectly fresh cup every time.
customer_reviews.author: MA resident

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy! I am on my third machine in 2 months! The machine short pours, and takes 3 minutes to brew 1 cup! There are coffee grounds in my coffee 2 out of 3 uses, and it doesn’t seal around the top of the k-cup so water squirts out of the top! The quick fix for customer service is to just send a new machine, but I keep having the same issues with no solution!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Thomas

customer_reviews.title: coffee without flavor
customer_reviews.text: I was really glad to receive my Keurig K-Elite. After setup I brewed my first K-Cup it hot as I wanted it, the coffee had no flavor it was as though I was drinking hot water. the water dispensed so fast in just a few seconds. I tried it for a week but there was no improvement after time. really really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as my last one
customer_reviews.text: I got this K-elite on the Amazon Prime day because of the price. Not as fancy as my K425 that we gave to our parents. Should have kept it and gave them this K-elite. It's cheaper plastic. Lid has to be taken all the way off instead of lifting a portion. No display allowing easy understanding on how to modify. And the K425 is just better looking. Good thing is that it's fast to turn on and brew coffee. Maybe time will make me fell better about the purchase. Still a good product but was spoiled with the K425.
customer_reviews.author: Cable & Monica

customer_reviews.title: Most recommended
customer_reviews.text: Received undamaged, and made first test cup of coffee. Quieter than my other Keurig 55 unit. Waited for a good sale before purchase. Very pleased with this new unit and will return here for a follow up once I had it for a month or so. Heard good reviews of this so hope for the long term.
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: What a disappointment!!!
customer_reviews.text: This machine was delivered on 12/10/18. I really liked it when I unpacked it. I followed the poor directions and brewed a cup of coffee. Everything was fine. After about a week, it continued to drip after the cup was finished. I tried to clean the needles that puncture the K-cup, didn't help. Then it started putting coffee grounds in my cup of coffee. I had had the Premium model for six years and it finally quite. The quality of the Elite is nowhere near the quality of the previous one. I called Amazon this morning and they sent me a return label I'm going with a different brand, no more Kurigs for me.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Miller

customer_reviews.title: Not the most reliable model
customer_reviews.text: 3 months old and quit working. The water just runs out when the power is turned on. I've cleaned it, run vinegar water though it, and it still doesn't work. I've had my other Keurig for over three years now, so this is truly disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Trudy

customer_reviews.title: K-Elite Coffee Maker by Keurig, Round 2
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product, if it holds up. The one I'm rating was actually a replacement from Amazon (thanks to Amazon for doing such a great customer service job on getting the replacement out!). The first one only lasted about five weeks before it completely stopped working. BTW, this replacement version makes good coffee but the blue LED light that illuminates the water reservoir quit working after two days; the LED was a cool feature but didn't affect coffee quality, so no big deal. Thanks to Amazon for taking care of Keurig's defects!
customer_reviews.author: Carl W. Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Makes a delicious cup of coffee!
customer_reviews.text: Really liking this Keurig Elite. Easy to set up and use. Makes great coffee, tea, cocoa. Strong brew option for those mornings when I need an extra boost. 75 ounce carafe is plenty big enough. I got the brushed silver which goes well with the other stainless appliances in my kitchen. Accepts all k cups as well as refillable ones. So far, so good. If things change I’ll update my review.
customer_reviews.author: E. Williams

customer_reviews.title: SHUTS OFF DURING BREW CYCLE
customer_reviews.text: Returned 2 of these after they both turned off in beginning of brew cycle. Seems to be a safety issue since it seemed to overload almost as soon as it started. Unacceptable. Ordered another model Keurig since I’ve had a Keurig for 5-6 years
customer_reviews.author: WILLIAM BRENNAN

customer_reviews.title: Love this Keurig!
customer_reviews.text: This one replaces another that stopped functioning properly! Spouse and I really like this one. Though I seldomly drink coffee, I love the 'my k-cup' feature because it brews well and coffee tastes fabulous! A happy camper customer! The carafe holds a lot of water. I recommend this Keurig K-Elite.
customer_reviews.author: Tootsie

customer_reviews.title: Worked great until it didn't...!
customer_reviews.text: Keurigs are really made to lower standards these days! My original one lasted for years, but each one since then has had to be replaced every 1-2 years. Now, this one -- I love everything about it except that after just a couple of months it has a developed a major problem. About every 3rd time you turn the unit on, it immediately starts squirting water out and will do so until it empties the whole water canister! After flooding our counter the first couple of times, we've learned to have a pitcher handy to catch the water! I will contact Keurig and see what they will do....
customer_reviews.author: Ozarks1

customer_reviews.title: Hard to beat the convenience
customer_reviews.text: Love this machine. Bought it for my wife, but now I use it all the time, too. I never thought I'd take convenience over freshly grinding my own beans, but here I am. I have the inserts that let me use my own grind, but haven't tried that yet. I get compostable k-cups, so I don't waste so much plastic. (Except for the flavored ones we can't stop drinking, like Kahlua.) Only thing about the machine itself that I would prefer different is if the fill tank were on the right side instead of the left, so it would be easier for this righty to fill.
customer_reviews.author: H. MOON

customer_reviews.title: Coffee coffee coffee!!
customer_reviews.text: I've had a keriug for years and this is my 3rd purchase. I decided this time to go for a larger water compartment. Definitely more pricey than my last models but well worth it. Sleek design that is plastic but looks high end. So far easy to clean and I haven't had any issues. I will say this, I was a little sceptical about the purchase cause some say that coffee leaked everywhere. You do have to push the kcup down firmly to puncture it in place. So follow the instructions and you will be fine cause I've had no issues with leaking.
customer_reviews.author: kristina

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade from the Keurig Classic
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to upgrade from our Keurig Classic. The extra features are a welcome addition: - Charcoal filtering option - More cup sizes - Better brew at large sizes (the classic just felt watered down when I used the largest size) - Strong brew option - Hot water option - Auto on and off - Larger water reservoir - Different finish options All of these features are easy to use and make this coffee maker worth a little extra money. Some people complained of leaking. I do not have this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Molly

customer_reviews.title: Malfunctions regularly
customer_reviews.text: Leak, leak, leak and half the time the machine doesn’t detect the water reservoir is full. Most cups don’t brew the correct size. Very annoying and unreliable coffee brewer! Customer service is a joke.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Best model ever.
customer_reviews.text: This model is fantastic. I have owned other models and this one is the best. The buttons on the top are so easy to use. The flavor is great and brews fast. The temperature is spot on even using the hot water, perfect temperature for brewing tea. It is super easy to clean with no issues. You will love this model.
customer_reviews.author: Louise Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working reliably after a week
customer_reviews.text: What a hassle it is to make coffee with this thing!! Opened it up about a week ago. Looks beautiful and very simple to operate. First week, all went well. Now, however, I rarely can brew a full cup of coffee successfully. I either get about 1/3 the amount I should get (I'm using the next to largest cup size), or water doesn't flow through it at all. I've cleaned everything, I've made sure everything was seated properly. I even removed the filter - though that made no difference. It's as if it doesn't want to draw all the water up that it should. It's so frustrating! I will attempt to return this if possible.
customer_reviews.author: T. Grogan

customer_reviews.title: Worked for almost 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.text: Love the ease of this and it is fairly quiet. Better than our original Keurig. Pretty too. It was defective as it quit working totally after less than 2 weeks. But I called Amazon. They shipped a new one that day (on a Saturday). It came on Monday. Great service Amazon! Keeping the box in case.
customer_reviews.author: nancy

customer_reviews.title: Now we're talking!
customer_reviews.text: It was really hard to find a good coffee maker... Finally I decided to go with this one and I have more than 2 months using it so far and I haven't had any issue with it. I use it with a coffee cud filter to make my own coffe but if you use the K-Cups, it's even better. I like all the size option it has. I will update if I face a problem in the future.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: No light in the water tank
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking it had the light in the water tank like was shown in the customer reviews for the K-Elite. It doesn't have it, which was disappointing to me. The material used seems solid. No leaking, easy to setup timers.
customer_reviews.author: Meghyn W.

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for me. It's oh so much nicer than the old basic model that died. It's quick and quiet compared to the older model. It has a larger reservoir and I really like all the size options for my hot and iced coffee. I wish I had bought this a LONG time ago.
customer_reviews.author: GC

customer_reviews.title: Trips my electrical breaker
customer_reviews.text: Is it convenient, yes. Does it make a fine cup of coffee , yes. Unfortunately, it creates a "nuisance trip" and blows a breaker even when not in use. After two electricians visit and a few hunderd dollars out of my wallet, it's been determined the coffee pot can not sit on my kitchen counter. A waste of money in so many ways.
customer_reviews.author: runcix

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this !!
customer_reviews.text: Usually a house of tea drinkers ,we ordered this because at 33wks pregnant ,I've now acquried a craving for coffee and with everything going on ,grabbing a cup just doesn't seem practical(plus I'm sure we'll need this after the baby is born ) So we looked for something that could do hot water for tea and make coffee too. Set up was easy and the instructions aren't hard to understand. I love the brushed steel color as it matches the other appliances in our kitchen. Haven't had any leakage ( I filled it up just under the max line and listened for the click when putting the reservoir back on the machine ) .
customer_reviews.author: Augustina

customer_reviews.title: More is Less.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a 2 year-old Keurig.. Basically it’s the same machine without the touch screen, nightlight, setting to brew hot chocolate, tea, etc. It still has one of the big faults of every Kerrigan I’ve seen. The reservoir is on the LEFT side of the machine. This almost forces right handed people to pour with their left hand. If your coffee maker is to the right of a wall, refrigerator, etc., it’s almost impossible to pour without spilling. Earlier Keurigs had a hatch over the reservoir so you could lift it and pour water inside. To add water, this Kerueg requires you to remove the entire lid. Newer machine costs the same, but provides less.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Sharpton

customer_reviews.title: High Maintence - We’ve Broken Up Twice
customer_reviews.text: I like the features of this Keurig, however, I constantly have to take a paper clip and insert it into the holes of the pod piercer to dislodge KCup coffee grounds. We’re talking about every 5th brew. Coffee grounds are constantly getting caught in it, preventing my machine from working. I even sent the first one that was delivered to me back to Amazon, thinking I had a defected machine. My old, generic Keurig was faithful for years and never required me to constantly be dislodging grounds.
customer_reviews.author: Cris

customer_reviews.title: Needs Attention
customer_reviews.text: This Kuerig, like all the rest needs constant attention. The purer the water going in ,the less problems you will find. This is my sixth Kuerig and I have learned from experience that the filter needs to be changed ,at least every two months and descaling about the same time. This will prevent the machine from having problems. My only complaint is that the hottest temp is 196 degrees. I would like to see the temp closer to the boiling point especially if one adds milk or other whiteners. Overall I like this new machine and ,hopefully, it will outlast my other past models.
customer_reviews.author: Gatti

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money buying this version. It works when it wants to. Sometimes the water will start coming out and then it stops dead. Sometimes it there's no water at all. To restart it is a nightmare. Then there are times when a lot of coffee grounds are in my cup. I've had Keurigs for years. All of them worked perfectly for many years. Not this one!! Plus, it is passed the time I can return it. What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Szalach

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Terrible quality, only 5 months old an maybe it works and maybe it doesn't. No help from Keurig customer service. Big mistake to purchase on my part.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Dora

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was a good buy for the price tag, quality, and ease of use. I'm very happy with it but I must take away half a star due to, what I believe, a small design flaw for the water tank. The water tank is on the left side so if you reach to pick it up or move it, the tank will fall right off while in your hands. Grabbing it front to back it will move just fine, but most people are inclined to grab it from the sides. I have spilled it a couple of times but now I just use a cup to fill it without removing the tank. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Tanner morse

customer_reviews.title: First Keurig User Here and OMG I can taste what all the fuze is about.
customer_reviews.text: I was really skeptical about buying a $150 coffee machine that can do the same as a $15 one. Also, all that plastic waste with the K-cups. But, I did some research and discovered Eco- Friendly K-Cups as well as Refillable K-Cups and I cave in and went and bought the Elite. OMG, I can understand now why they are so popular. I definitely recommend this to anyone. The coffee taste is so much richer and I use my same coffee as always. So fast and easy to do coffee in the morning. The Elite it a sleeker version that you can definitely admire in your counter top.
customer_reviews.author: Ali_CS

customer_reviews.title: I cautiously recommend this one.
customer_reviews.text: Ok, this is my third Keurig in 10 days. First time I used it it did exactly the same thing as the first two which was the green light was on and then blue lights come on. When I hit the blue light button it just turned off. I just couldn’t believe it. But I started over and have had it for several days now and so far that hasn’t happened again. I paid more for this one. If it breaks it will be my last Keurig.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara M

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product, but found it later at Costco for $99.99
customer_reviews.author: Mouth

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous Machine!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th Keurig, I keep moving up...my last one had the digital display but I like this one WAY better!! You can tell its sleeker/smoother...also the top of the water refill comes off which makes filling so much easier for me. My purple EZ refillable coffee filters make the best coffee with this machine (i also use the paper inserts so that clean up is a breeze).and the best part is that it looks beautify with the gold rose color :)
customer_reviews.author: Elisabeth D

customer_reviews.title: Buy if you want coffee grounds in your cup
customer_reviews.text: Decided to upgrade our "basic" kureg with this option. Recieved in December and it worked as expected until the end of January. It started to malfunction and not brew. We use reusable cups, sold by kureg, and water started overflowing the cups - which resulted in grounds in the brewed coffee. Contacted Kureg directly and they were of no help. Refused to address our issues or provide guidance on how to troubleshoot except to say we needed to use filtered water - which we do. We down graded back to the basic kureg in march and have been much happier with a coffee machine that actually works.
customer_reviews.author: Rhandi32

customer_reviews.title: Excellent design and build quality
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded a several year old Keurig machine with this one and it exceeded my expectations. It's so much more refined than my old one. The aluminum open/close handled and mechanism feels much better and more sturdy than the old one. The internal mechanism must be very different because it is much more quiet and pleasant sounding. The controls are intuitive and effective. I really like how you don't have to wait for it to heat after turning it one to make brewing selections. If you are thinking about upgrading, this version is much improved over past models.
customer_reviews.author: LarryTru

customer_reviews.title: Not for a two-temperature household
customer_reviews.text: Please note that this review pertains only to a household that wants to use two brewing temperatures, e.g. coffee (192F) and some loose teas (187F). We have had Keurig brewers for some time, and have generally happy with them, but this K-Elite is very poorly designed. For example, there is no way of knowing that a special brewing temperature (e.g. 187F) has been set excerpt by going through the entire menu or waiting for the menu to stop blinking. Even worse, if the coffee maker brews first and then removes the pod and closes the lid, the tea maker has to wait (one full minute) until the size-selector menu stops blinking before the brew temperature can be changed. Very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Richard K

customer_reviews.title: Auto on does not work all the time
customer_reviews.text: This is the fourth Keurig I have bought. I have always been pleased with them however, this one does not come on automatically all the time, I called the company to see if there was something I could do and the person on the phone told me to quit using the auto off feature as they sometimes have a problem when that feature is enabled!! I told her the auto off is the main reason to use the auto on, I would not have to worry about leaving it on!! Not happy with this machine!
customer_reviews.author: Pauline Heisner

customer_reviews.title: Tripped AFCI breakers
customer_reviews.text: I hate having to send this good looking brewer back, but there seems to be an electrical issue in the unit causing arc fault breakers to trip. Built this house last year so wiring, breakers, etc. are all new and to code. No other appliance or item trips the breakers. This machine trips ALL of them even if the sole item on the circuit. Breakers for kitchen and baths are dual AFCI/GFCI and it trips those. Breakers for bedrooms, living room, dining room are ACFI only and it trips those too. This brewer looks good and has nice features. If your breakers aren't ACFI, then it will probably work without issue.
customer_reviews.author: John Watt

customer_reviews.title: Leaks all over!
customer_reviews.text: My Keurig Elite bought April 2019 started leaking water from the bottom (not the reservoir on July 31. It cannot be fixed. Three months for $160+. Not happy! Had my last Keurig 8 years, still worked just wanted an upgrade. Unfortunately gave it away. I have to say though very impressed by Keurig who, even though I bought at Amazon, sent me a new one the day I “complained”. Great customer service
customer_reviews.author: Jo Ann

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing.  It keeps stalling during mid-brew.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this model because this family of 5 really loves the ease of using a Keurig maker and the water capacity was impressive. My first Keurig was FLAWLESS. This one has been consistently stalling after about 2 seconds after pushing the start button. Plenty of water.This one just doesn't perform well at all. WISH I HAD A REPLACEMENT.
customer_reviews.author: Nickie.H

customer_reviews.title: GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: I love this coffee maker. The iced coffee and hot water feature are great. The best thing is that you can program it to turn on and off. If you want a cup at a different time, it takes no time at all to turn on AND you can go ahead and press the button for your coffee to brew after it warms up! The temperature adjustment is "meh" as the range is not very noticeable. It is not like at starbucks when they can make a drink "kiddie" temp. But, overall, I love it :) PLUS, it is very stylish and sleek looking...
customer_reviews.author: Paige

customer_reviews.title: Love the convenience of my Keurig!
customer_reviews.text: I had put off buying a Keurig for years, simply because I'm a tea drinker and not a coffee drinker, and, after all, how hard is it to make tea? But I had experience with a Keurig from when my mom lived with me for a couple of years several years ago and brought hers with her. I finally broke down and bought one for myself. Now I'm kicking myself for not purchasing one for myself sooner. The convenience simply means that I will drink more tea and less (or no) sodas. It works beautifully, just like I remembered. I'm very much enjoying my Keurig!
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Defective - draws over 20 amps and horrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: Despite the Keurig website claim of being a 1500W appliance, this unit draws so much power it trips my 20 Amp circuit breaker. I called Keurig customer service and after two clueless agents and more than a half hour of talking they could offer absolutely nothing to help. Wouldn't even replace it with a lower end model. This is a brand new unit. Even if you get past that part in your own home, be prepared for a heavy water tank with no real grip and the loudest heating cycle you can imagine.
customer_reviews.author: amc

customer_reviews.title: Cheap product.... do not waste your money.. huge disappointment
customer_reviews.text: This product only works with pressing the strong button (to get a normal strength cup result) and you have to hit travel mug which does not even fill my mug. Then when the brewing is complete I wait a minute or so but it doesn’t matter because the second I lift the top part where the krup goes in coffee water dumps all down the front of it and even sometimes will hit the counter missing the drip collector. This is the absolute worst investment ever. I should have just set my money on fire in the driveway.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Keurig, please pay attention!
customer_reviews.text: I previously had the Keurig 575 and now have the K-Elite. I love that my travel mug fits in the new model and that it brews much more quickly, but PLEASE bring back the water reservoir style of the 575! I miss: 1. the transparent front panel of the 575's reservoir 2. the 575 reservoir's hinged lid 3. the extra 5 oz. of the 575's reservoir Looking forward to the next iteration, hopefully to include one or more of those features. I'm also eagerly waiting for Keurig and other coffee pod makers to come out with many more recyclable pods -- that should be an absolute priority!
customer_reviews.author: A. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with product
customer_reviews.text: Water pours out every time I turn it on. The water is cold and will drain the whole tank as soon as I press the on button. After I turn off, back on and refill water tank works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Goldie Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Size and Features
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace my Keurig 70B after at least a 10 year use. The K-Elite is everything I needed in a single serve coffee machine. The water tank is a good size and I’m not needing to add water every couple of cups of water. The entire lid needs to be removed, but I’ve become accustomed to the change. I will admit that I did prefer the little door on the older model. I can’t set an on and off time, but really, as quick as it brews it’s not been an issue that I initially thought I’d miss. Great machine, does what it’s supposed to do, I would recommend to anyone looking for an easy to operate keurig.
customer_reviews.author: SuzieShopper

customer_reviews.title: Nice Hot Coffee or Tea
customer_reviews.text: We've had several Keurig machines and this is my favorite by far! You can even make iced coffee with it. The water reservoir is a good size and it still doesn't take up too much space on the counter. The adjustable sizes are nice and the water comes through really hot. It also takes those to go car cups!
customer_reviews.author: Sound Diva

customer_reviews.title: Love all the functions
customer_reviews.text: I went on a Keurig hunt when my other one recently gave up the farm. I debated for a couple of weeks between this and one other model. I finally purchased this one just because of the iced coffee option. I absolutely love it. My daily drive thru habit has been quashed by this option. Brews great tasting over ice. I had to play with my coffee, French roast, breakfast blend, etc until I found the one that produced the taste profile I was looking for. Same result everyday! There is also a hot water feature that makes tea time super fast. I would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Jadesfire

customer_reviews.title: Deceptive junk
customer_reviews.text: I don’t drink coffee much, usually just on the weekends. Had it for about a month and was working fine. Now it either shuts off randomly while brewing, or will flip the circuit breaker right after brewing. I’ve even tried moving it all around the house and same thing. I’ve read it’s because I’m in a newly built home, who knows. Occasionally it will work just fine, but I never get my hopes up, neither should you.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: New to coffee , this machine works great!
customer_reviews.text: I got an old Keurig single machine for my mother years ago, she really loved , I really didn't drink coffee back then . Been drinking it more at work, so I got this one, very pleased with it! Never not hit the strong button, so I'm not sure how well it brews without pushing that button!
customer_reviews.author: MikeH

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Been awhile since I bought a new Keurig and I can say I'm pleased with some changes. First off this thing doesn't vibrate and make ridiculous sounds. Second off the overall build quality and features are very nice. If you're already a K-Cup user you will really like this machine. If you are not I would definitely recommend trying this is your first foray into K-Cups. I had read some reviews about this unit turning on and just pouring water on people's counters and floors, but I wonder if they're simply not setting the clock and the auto feature correctly...???
customer_reviews.author: damnisthistaken

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and uses off brand coffee pods
customer_reviews.text: We haven’t actually cleaning it yet but it already seems easier than the older one I had! Comes with a filter that can be replaced which is nice!! We’re abke to use the Great Value coffee pods with this which is also a bonus for us because most of the K-cup pods are expensive sadly. I bought my boyfriend the slate one and we love it!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Easy to prepare coffee...
customer_reviews.text: I like it for the convenience.....looks great on the counter....eventually bought the convenient drawer....but it raises the machine so to use it, it has to be pulled out from under the cabinet....no big deal...at first coffee did not come out hot enough....the directions explained how to adjust the heat....I also find I can get two cups out of it...just put it thru the second time.....good looking machine...
customer_reviews.author: barbara

customer_reviews.title: The long wait is over
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I have looked for a Keurig that would not disappoint with luke warm temperatures and flimsy parts. We had stated and and AirB&B and the model they had was excellent, allowing you to set the temperature you preferred. We bought a model that was an newer edition and it did not disappoint. This Keurig make nice hot coffee. It's easy to clean and everything fits together nicely. I can't wait for my coffee every morning. Or hot tea, or hot chocolate. Love, Love, Love my Keurig. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: K. D.

customer_reviews.title: Its already broke.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this brewer December 2019. Today, April 15, 2020 the brewer will not work. It shuts off the second you hit any buttons to brew. I am very disappointed. I have reached out to Amazon and Kuerig. I hope I can get my machine replaced. It should not be failing after a little over 4 months. My last kuerig lasted 6 years.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Cutshall

customer_reviews.title: Keurig products are great. They simplified my life
customer_reviews.text: Well let me begin by saying Keurig I love your products. The only reason I disliked this keurig was the filter thingy that holds the filter was hard to put on. So it broke and I had to return it. I did get another Keurig cafe but a small one that requires no filter.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Grace Marie

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Lets face it- we all compare any coffee pot taste to Starbucks and without a commercial machine you just can't duplicate it at home. That being said this is a nice machine. It's much quieter than my classic. Love the Iced coffee button! Love all the buttons in general over the touch screen. Really like that I can turn it off and on at will. I do wish I didn't have to refill the water tank when it's still half full. Still makes the best flavored coffee and I like it strong!
customer_reviews.author: cafelover

customer_reviews.title: Hot water not that hot; water reservoir heavy
customer_reviews.text: When using the hot water feature, though turned up to the highest setting, the end result is that the water is NOT that hot, for oatmeal (for example). Also, when filling the large water reservoir, it becomes heavy and awkward -- would be nice if there were more of a handle. The reason for the 3 (easy to clean) is ony because I have not yet attempted it, but Keurigs, in general, do not seem easy to clean. . . We do use the filter and try to remember to change it regularly.
customer_reviews.author: the nak

customer_reviews.title: K cups explode!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th keurig and I have had no problems before using kcups from other manufacturers . I drink only decaf flavored and keurig only offers two decaf flavors so I order from crazy cups and perfect samplers through Amazon. Never had a problem until now. The brewer shuts off midstream. I open the lid and coffee grounds and water run out all over the place . Very disappointed. Would have reviewed sooner but I went out of town to visit family so didn’t unpack to use until I got back home in late March.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen C

customer_reviews.title: Over priced
customer_reviews.text: Had it for about 3 weeks so far. Doesn’t have feature that tells you coffee is ready to brew. Supposed to listen to sound ....you would think for $169 it would. Can fit a 7.25 inch travel mug _ which is main reason I bought it. Item over priced by about $60. Previous machine made by this manufacture turned into lottery ....never knew whether you would get 3 or 15 ounces. If this one ford the same after awhile, will have to go to different manufacturer. 3 stars because it is over priced.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Duprey

customer_reviews.title: Love It!  Especially the Iced Feature
customer_reviews.text: I love this Keurig. It replaced my last one that I had for 3 - 1/2 years. Granted, I have had older coffee pots, but enjoyment versus price makes this a good value to me. For this one, I ordered the next model up. I was waffling on spending the extra money, but now I am so glad I did! I love being able to make ice coffee at times and others in the household will make ice tea. I also like the ability to set the on feature so that it is ready to go first thing when I get up. If this one last 3 years, I'll be good and will get another next time most likely.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great, looks great!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I recently decided to start drinking more coffee and less energy drinks. We had a traditional coffee pot with filter and a glass carafe. But we were looking for an easier and faster morning routine. This is our first Keurig, easy to use, and love it. I really like the timer, not only does it have the usual wake up mode, but you can also set it when to turn off and back in sleep mode. Gotta love not messing with filters or trying not to break your glass carafe while washing it! Also the finish on this Keurig is nice! Doesn't look like cheap plastic like most home coffee makers. Nice upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Garay

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the hype
customer_reviews.text: What a huge disappointment! I waited years to finally buy one of these, not wanting to spend over $100 on a coffeemaker when the $10 Walmart special I’ve had has worked fine for over 5 years. However; I finally bought into the hype and bought myself one for Christmas. By the second day, it was already having problems and would brew a half second and shut itself off. I unplugged it for a few minutes and it would work again... until the next time. Now, after only 2 months, it’s not working at all! Apparently it’s a common problem. Sure glad I kept my Walmart special!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cant keep time...
customer_reviews.text: Makes coffee just like any other K cup brewer on the market, like the hot water only function as well. HOWEVER, it couldnt keep time if its life depended on it. Every brew cycle it loses a minute or two and seems to reset (clicking and blinking screen) often making it loose more time. If you plan to use the timer functions I suggest not buying this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I'm so disappointed in this Keurig - it has to be reset every single time I make a cup of coffee which means the water has to heat up every time - and it's really loud - my last Keurig wasn't this loud - I'd send it back but I don't have the original box and Keurig customer service doesn't even bother to answer my emails.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Arell

customer_reviews.title: Great Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: This model Keurig Elite is great. It heats the water and makes the coffee in about a minute. The larger reservoir is nice because you don't have to fill it every to cups like the old one we had. The features it has are also nice.
customer_reviews.author: starpilot51

customer_reviews.title: Brews Perfecto Everytime.
customer_reviews.text: Best one so far. I bought a Mr Coffee a few years ago and it sucked so I stayed away from K Cups for years. Got sick of always cleaning the grounds but wanted tasty coffee. Well this Brewer is really working for me. I assume it would do the same for you. I gave it 5 big old stars because it makes my day easy in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: Benny the Cat

customer_reviews.title: Coffee Maker died after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: I have used Keurig coffee makers for years, with no problems. This one worked fine for 1 month, but began acting up after that - water would heat, but the coffee maker would shut itself off after I pressed a brewing button. I called Keurig, with no success. This is the worst coffee maker I've ever purchased!
customer_reviews.author: Donna Mariotti

customer_reviews.title: NO light and very loud
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this brewer after my previous one stopped working..had it 5 years with zero problems and Im very impressed with how long it lasted..very quiet and had a reservoir light...but I'm very disappointed with the k elite..it makes a good cup of coffee but extremely loud..much louder than my previous one..plus No light in the reservoir...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Big improvement on my original Keurig
customer_reviews.text: A couple of features I really like are 1. ability to turn in the machine, put in the pod & place the cup so when the machine is up to temp, it automatically brews & 2. The strong button Works! But what I would really like is to use the strong button when in iced coffee mode. If there’s a way to make work when brewing iced coffee, let me know...perhaps @keurig?
customer_reviews.author: BlkE350

customer_reviews.title: it became intermittent  1 day past return time.
customer_reviews.text: it would be nice if these keurig gadgets were as good as the price you pay for them. It became intermittent . I sent a request to the co. and got back a reply of request Id of 91-5117483463. that has been it. I guess I should not have requested an exchange. The maker we replaced was very bad at not giving out the amount you asked for but this thing will ,just as often ,give out too much so you need a cup that can handle to over run. When this thing gets too unreliable we will not replace it with keurig.
customer_reviews.author: TM

customer_reviews.title: We like it.  Its fast and convienet to use.
customer_reviews.text: I drink regular coffee and my wife likes decaf, coco and tea, etc. Its nice to get a quick cup of coffee in about 30 seconds or so or switch to a different beverage in a jiffy. The pods are higher no doubt but then again I have poured a lot of unused coffee down the drain over the years. If you have a bunch of people for breakfast I would make a pot but if I want a cup on my way out the door for work I use this for sure.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Another Leaker, but Keurig comes thru.....
customer_reviews.text: I recently ordered the K-Elite to replace my 3 year old K55 which became quite noisy on the water pump. The K-Elite is quiet and we have been quite satisfied until it started leaking water similar to other customer reviews. It has leaked water twice and the coffee maker is not even a month old. Called Keurig Customer Service this morning and after a 10 minute conversation, Keurig is sending me a new unit. I'm hopeful the replacement coffee maker will not have the same issue. Will do a follow-up review after I receive the replacement unit and run it thru its paces.
customer_reviews.author: Leno

customer_reviews.title: Keurig K-Elite Coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Keurig K-Elite Coffee Maker because it looked pretty good online. I have owned one for the past 4 years and it was very nice. All the parts were made heavy duty and the machine had weight to it, but this unit was nothing like my old one. It is all plastic and probably made overseas in some third world. I followed the directions, even asked my husband to double check, and tried to make a cup of coffee. Water poured out the right side of the unit every time I tried. I finally gave up, boxed it up and sent it back for a refund. I cleaned up my old unit and it works perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Debhou

customer_reviews.title: Hot, flavorful coffee
customer_reviews.text: There is a learning curve if you don't use Kcups. The filter is easy, once you determine which machine you have. I had to remove one clip and then figure out how to load the coffee into the filter holder. Took me several cups and now I have it. The coffee consistently is brewed at 192. The most expensive machines work at 197 but I can live with this. I always look at plastic things and ask myself what to I need to buy a second one of. I purchased 4 of the self filling filters and plan to purchase a second water container. Cheap of them not to throw in at least one scale cleaning packet.
customer_reviews.author: B. D. Larr

customer_reviews.title: strong brew button stopped working almost immediately -
customer_reviews.text: the strong brew button stopped working almost immediately. i like all the options, the price was fine, but i would really like it to work - the strong brew is one reason i bought this machine. haven't contacted them yet for return, fix options, but hopefully, they will take care of this since it stopped working less than a month into it...
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth F

customer_reviews.title: Fits My Tall Coffee Mug!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fairly good Keurig. The coffee tastes good, and it fits my 24 oz Tervis cup underneath (with drip tray removed), which cannot be said about most Keurig’s. Usually I have to prop up the Keurig to be tall enough to accommodate my tall mugs. I like filling my mug with 16 oz of ice and 8 oz of strong coffee. My biggest objection is that the timer is inconsistent. I schedule it to turn on early, and then turn off after I go to work. I swear it used to work, but now it’s only on a few days a week. I’m generally pretty tech savvy, but I can’t figure out what I did wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Webb

customer_reviews.title: Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: Makes great coffee and you can use any brand of coffee. The large water container makes if easy to fill and lasts several days. Have only had it for a month, but so far it is working good. Will update if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: Simba

customer_reviews.title: Love the Keurig as we prefer different types of coffee.
customer_reviews.text: This has stood up well to daily use. We usually have four types of coffee around. Everyone seems to prefer a different type, so it allows us to use one coffee maker and have our variety.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hot and freash.
customer_reviews.text: My husband was always against me buying a new coffee maker. He is so used to the old school one. After I taught him how to use it, we have put the old school one under the cabinet. After he tasted how fresh the coffee is when you use the k cups, and how fast and hot it is, I don't think he's going back to reheating old standing coffee from a coffee pot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: k cups for life
customer_reviews.text: I was just casually looking up Keurig's and noticed that this was on sale for a killer price. Prime Same-Day this bad boy and got it that night. It even came with a little variety pack box to get your started until you run to the store for more k cups.
customer_reviews.author: Des Cabinatan

customer_reviews.title: Was skeptical of getting a good cup of coffee...
customer_reviews.text: This is my first pod machine and I must say I'm very surprised at how good a cup of coffee it makes. The more difficult thing is finding a pod I like. In the end I seem to like Pete's the best. So far very happy with this purchase and happy that I don't waste coffee and energy as with a traditional make would be.
customer_reviews.author: CPO

customer_reviews.title: I waited a long time to get one of these, and I'm so disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I thought these were cool. The trouble is with even the largest cup you can use, the coffee is still very strong and bitter, and all I can do is go to a smaller cup that will make things worse! I HATE having to add hot water to my coffee every day (I drink it black so it's 100% coffee taste). I would never buy one again! Plus, the coffee is SO EXPENSIVE using this method. Boo
customer_reviews.author: Cindy S.

customer_reviews.title: It LEAKS!!! So frustrating....
customer_reviews.text: We used this less than a year and it started to leak. It is so infuriating! I picked this model over others and It definitely was NOT worth it for us. I only drink 1 cup every so often, so it doesn’t get frequent use. If we fill up the water reservoir with more than 2 cups it starts to leak all over the counter! This is the first negative review we have left on Amazon. I sure hope they’ve fixed it!!! Will update with photos when I get a chance.
customer_reviews.author: TXJewels

customer_reviews.title: Premium  kcup coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement for my old kcup coffee maker. I’ve owned about 4 other kcup coffee makers but this was the most expensive one so far but we use it 4 times a day every day so I think we needed to pay the price. It works great and is fast and so far all is well. The burnished gold color is very nice and the size of the unit is great. I registered it with Keurig and got a good deal on kcup coffee for doing that.
customer_reviews.author: Dr.TE

customer_reviews.title: After very slow delivery. It came scratched on handle.
customer_reviews.text: As for the coffee maker I like it ok. But it finally came today and has very visible Scratch on the handle. For the $165.00, I kind of expected it to be without blemish. To return you have to p a y shipping! I am resubmitting this with pictures for proof that it did come scratched. They asked for pictures, so here they are.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth

customer_reviews.title: Used sold as new
customer_reviews.text: Ordered new but got used and even wet. Not very nice to drink coffee and to know somebody used it. Very disappointed do not buy from those crooks.
customer_reviews.author: Aidas Krapikas

customer_reviews.title: Simple and elegant. Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Looks great, easy to operate. We use the iced coffee feature pretty often too and it works great. Holds more water than old model. Love the buttons, so simple.
customer_reviews.author: JohnnyD

customer_reviews.title: When brewing tea, machine clogs & shuts off
customer_reviews.text: I've had Keurigs for years. This model is a nightmare. First machine clogged when brewing Celestial Seasoning tea K-cups (which I purchased on Keurig's site). Called Keurig customer service and they made me go find a paper clip and stick it in the needle spout to clean it. This did not work and the machine clogged/shut off again. They sent me a replacement machine (brand new in the box) and the SAME EXACT thing happened. I'm tired of this nonsense and I wish I knew of a viable replacement option made by a different company.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Keurig
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good Keurig. I have had other Keurig’s and they were good but they don’t make that kind any longer. I looked around and saw that this one had everything I needed. It has a larger reservoir I really like that. I use spring water in mine and you will find that you don’t have to change the filter as much. I would recommend this Keurig.
customer_reviews.author: Lana Hartman

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight. Great for single serve coffee!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing so much. I had another keurig that died. This one is so much lighter and better. Way more options. I'm so happy!
customer_reviews.author: CJ Galarza

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product and My Daily Morning Friend :)
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and get going right away. Easy to figure out how to use and brews great cups of coffee every time. Feel confident in purchasing this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I originally wanted a basic inexpensive Keuring, but decided to upgrade after reading all of the mediocre reviews of the other models. I'm very happy that I did. This model is very high quality and offers a great deal of options. Though a little larger than the mini, this one is still not terribly large. I'd recommend this one to anyone looking for a quality Keurig.
customer_reviews.author: MJ Snow

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE my new keurig! It has saved me soo much time and money! I can finally make coffee cubes with ease, so when I make iced coffee with this machine it still tastes like coffee after they melt! Does it amount to Starbucks? No, but I’ve been getting more and more creative with the help of all the various flavors of k cups that are compatible this machine (which is A LOT) to get the flavors I love and the caffeine I need in those early morning rushes. It’s literally saving my life right now. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bought for the reservoir, Love for the versatility
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a gift for my wife, and it is such an amazing upgrade from the old models! The reservoir is HUGE! comes with a filter. So many sizes to choose from, and on those mornings you stiff a stiff cup of Joe, put in your favorite robust blend, hit the Strong button, and prepare yourself for the wake-up juice! The model also cleans easier and the handle- this handle I am in love with, it just feels better than the old plastic ones on the older models. A really-well-built machine.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Best family purchase
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a Christmas present for the family. We are not coffee drinkers but we love hot chocolate. This makes hot chocolate easy and at the perfect temperature. Our favorite part is being able to get hot water for soup. The programming allows it to get the water warm in the morning so the kids can get a drink before they leave to school
customer_reviews.author: Twall

product_meta.title: Keurig K-Elite Coffee Maker, Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Brewer, With Iced Coffee Capability, Brushed Gold
product_meta.description: Color:Brushed GoldThe Keurig K-Elite brewer blends premium finish and programmable features together to deliver both modern design and the ultimate in beverage customization. With a striking brushed finish and metal details, it’s a stylish addition to any kitchen. The Keurig K-Elite single serve coffee maker features a Strong Brew setting when you want to brew a bolder cup of coffee, and an Iced setting to brew hot over ice for a refreshing, full-flavored iced coffee. It features five brew sizes, so you can brew 4, 6, 8, 10, or 12oz of your favorite coffee, tea, hot cocoa, or iced beverage at the touch of a button. Choose from hundreds of delicious varieties of K-Cup pods, or brew your own ground coffee using the Universal My K-Cup Reusable Coffee Filter (sold separately). In addition to a host of programmable features like temperature control, the Keurig K-Elite coffee maker provides hot water on demand for instant soups and oatmeal, and the large 75oz removable water filter lets you brew 8 cups between refills.
feature_bullets: BREWS MULTIPLE CUP SIZES: 4, 6, 8, 10, 12 ounce Enjoy the most popular cup sizes
STRONG BREW BUTTON: Increases the strength and bold taste of your coffee’s flavor
ICED SETTING: Brew hot over ice at the touch of a button for full-flavored, delicious iced coffee
HOT WATER ON DEMAND BUTTON: Perfect for instant soups or oatmeal
WHAT'S IN THE BOX: One water filter handle, and one filter to help ensure your beverages taste their absolute best
FAST & FRESH BREWED: Coffee made in minutes
LARGE 75oz WATER RESERVOIR: Allows you to brew 8 cups before having to refill, saving you time and simplifying your morning routine. Removable reservoir makes refilling easy
REMOVABLE DRIP TRAY: Accommodates travel mugs up to 7.2 inches tall and holds a full accidental brew for easy cleanup
BREWER MAINTENANCE REMINDER: Alerts you when it is time to descale your coffee maker. Descaling is an important process that removes built-up calcium deposits, ensuring the best-tasting brew possible
QUIET BREW TECHNOLOGY: Minimizes noise when the coffee maker is in use

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars6,930 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
